text:
s	passed	through	
the wall of the abdomen 
into	the	amniotic	fluid	that	
surrounds your baby. Within 
the	fluid	are	cells	that	contain	
the same chromosomes as 
your baby. A small sample of 
this	fluid	is	drawn	off	and	sent	
to a laboratory for testing. 
Most women feel only mild 
discomfort.
Usually,	the	fluid	will	be	
tested for Down’s syndrome, 
Edwards’ syndrome and 
Patau’s syndrome. The results 
should be available within three 
working days.
